question: What are the odds of a single woman being at this thing?

They reach the steps of the house next door. PARTY NOISE comes from within, shadows move in the windows. Tom swings Maggie around, puts her on the step, wraps his arms around her, and kisses her. answer: California. To my father's house. My real father, not -- -- Duane. Jake would be safe at my father's house, we'd both be safe there.

question: No, Herman, you're a freak. "Mutants" is a better word for the rest of us. He pulls 'ip a chair and sits down opposite Tom. On the other side of tie room, Vivian and Beverly tell an animated two-part story to he teenage girl and the homey, finishing each others' se. .tences . NEIL Like any other part of our body, our brains have evolved a lot in a hundred thousand years. Our first thoughts were formless. Struggling consciousness. Sensation. An instinctive tie to our environment. But then our brains began to focus. We sacrificed the intuitions we first had so our thoughts could be directed, so we could master specific functions. That's where we are at the moment. We're brilliant with technique, but we've given up instinct. So the next evolutionary step, the step yet to come, or perhaps it's already in the making, is actually backward. To maintain our higher functions, but reawaken the part of our brain that was pure intuition. That was receptive to anything, because it didn't know enough not to believe. You're a freak of nature, pal, an evolutionary step. You're double- jointed. Up here.
answer: Are we the only ones?

question: Hardly. I've heard of groups like ours in San Francisco, New York, Minneapolis -- those are just the cities I've been to. Tom, you're what they used to call a medium. question: The ncxt generation. Much better flashlight.

question: First time I've heard that one. it comes all different ways. Sometimes it goes the same way it came.

question: Why do you assume she wants something?

question: Why me?

question: What do you mean? She can, it can make me do something I don't want to do?
answer: Oh, no. You'll want to. Badly. You won't think about anything else. You won't sleep. You won't eat. You'll lie. And God help anyone who tries to stop you.

answer: You scared me. And with that, he turns back to the job. Swing. CRUNCH.

question: S scared you? Swing. CRUNCH. MAGGIE Tom. Swing. CRUNCH. MAGGIE What are you doing?

He picks up his tee shirt, snakes angrily into it, and marches across the yard toward the house. TOM What are YOU lookin' at?

question: You gonna drink that? She doesn't answer. He takes her glass, drinks some. TOM I'm sorry. No answer. TOM Okay, I'm not sorry. She ignores him. He looks at the letter in her hands. TOM Who's that from?
answer: My brother Steve. My mother's going back in the hospital again. What? He shakes his head. MAGGIE What?

question: Nothing. They stare at each other. Tom's face is pale. Maggie is concerned. The phone RINGS. Maggie stares at Tom. The phone RINGS again. She lowers her voice, pleading.
answer: What is it? Tom can't look at her. The phone RINGS again. Tom gets up, opens the door that leads to the back yard, and goes outside.

question: When's the funeral?
answer: Sunday. We should leave as soon as we can.

question: We? She stiffens. TOM Oh, you, uh... you want me to go with you? She looks at him, deeply hurt. Then enraged. She pushes him away from her, hard. He stumbles back into the yard.
answer: Do I WANT you to come with me:! To my MOTHER'S FUNERAL?! Of COURSE L want you to come, why the hell WOULLV'T you come?! But he's looking past her, at the holes in the yard.

question: Jake, come on, we have to go.
answer: I'm staying here.

question: What?
answer: I want to stay at Uncle Steve's, I don't want to go home.

question: Why not?
answer: Because I'm not safe there. Because of the feathers.

question: Why do you want to be my friend?
answer: Are you kidding? Look at yourself! Kurt turns Samantha toward an old mirror that hangs over the fireplace. She's good-looking, if she knew it. Terribly insecure, doesn't even like looking at herself. We turn away, embarrassed. KURT Ah ah ah, look! He makes us look in the mirror again. KURT Mama, you are hot. He turns her toward him, looks at her, closely. KURT

question: Well.., you can kiss me if you want to. Kurt leans in close, kisses us. After a moment, we force our head away, looking down. Kurt's hand is on Samantha's breast. We push him back. SAMANTHA Not like that! But Kurt pulls us closer, roughly. We struggle.
answer: Come on, Samantha, I'll be your friend, I swear I will.

question: I have to go home. We struggle some more. He gets his powerful hanis on our shoulders and starts to push us down.
answer: Come on, baby, how `bout a little helmet wash? His belt buckle comes into our view, and his hands on it. We tear away, get up and run for the door. From behind, something hits us very hard. The floorboards race up at us, all of a sudden. We land on them, hard, bounce off, our own blood spraying out on the unfinished wood. Our head lands sideways on the floor. We see Adam McCarthy, vomiting in the corner. Abruptly, we're rolled over and are staring at the ceiling. Kurt Damon is on top of us, his face too close. Her hands rise up, try to push him off, but he's stronger. Samantha starts to SCREAM. Hands close over our face. She bites, and the hands are pulled away. She SCREAMS again. KURT

question: Come on, baby, how `bout a little helmet wash? His belt buckle comes into our view, and his hands on it. We tear away, get up and run for the door. From behind, something hits us very hard. The floorboards race up at us, all of a sudden. We land on them, hard, bounce off, our own blood spraying out on the unfinished wood. Our head lands sideways on the floor. We see Adam McCarthy, vomiting in the corner. Abruptly, we're rolled over and are staring at the ceiling. Kurt Damon is on top of us, his face too close. Her hands rise up, try to push him off, but he's stronger. Samantha starts to SCREAM. Hands close over our face. She bites, and the hands are pulled away. She SCREAMS again. KURT
answer: MAKE HER STOP! MAKE HER STOP

question: SHUT HER UP! USE YOUR JACKET OR
answer: Oh, my God.

question: What the fuck did you do that for?
answer: Is she dead?

question: No shit she's dead.
answer: Oh, my God.

question: Look at her tongue, man.
answer: I'm not here.

question: I never saw nobody dead before. We start to fall back, and down, as if sinking into the floor. Kurt and Adam grow taller, further away. Their voices fade.
answer: I wish I wasn't here.

question: It's fuckin' gross.
answer: This isn't happening.

question: Fuckin' plastic over her face. Good thinkin', Adam.
answer: What do we do now? Kurt and Adam are very far away, blobs of light at the end of a black tunnel that's closing in around us. Just before everything goes completely black --

question: How's he doin'? Frank shrugs. Can't talk much.
answer: He might make it. Might not. Sheila's over there now, I'm headed back.

question: Frank, I'm sorry. I'm sorry because... I think I know why Adam shot himself. And I have to call the police about it. But I don't want you to hear it from them, I don't want Sheila to read it in the paper. You have the right to know before anybody else.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: Come with me. He nods toward his own house. Frank stares at him, frightened, but what could possibly be worse than what's already happened?
answer: Hang on a second. What the hell is goin' on around here? Tom goes to the trap door and lowers himself halfway through. Frank follows.

question: How did you find this?
answer: Does it matter?

question: You don't know it was Adam and Kurt.
answer: It was.

question: But there's nothing to... you're talking like a nut, that's what people will say. This is just a body, it doesn't prove anything.
answer: No, it doesn't. He bends down and lifts Samantha's lifeless hand. He pries open her fingers. She's clutching a tuft of hair. TOM But this probably will. Frank stares for a long moment, struck dumb. Finally, he turns his back. His shoulders heave as he cries, silently.

question: Who you planning to shoot with that?
answer: Who do you think?

question: I think you haven't decided yet. He's right, and Frank knows it.
answer: Get out of here.

question: What are you gonna do, Frank? Frank raises the gun, in a fury. Frank, I won't go until you- Frank aims the gun just to the left of Tom's head and pulls the trigger. The bullet CRACKS off the ladder.
answer: GET OUT! GET OUT! Tom starts up the ladder.
